sentence.Network_en: There is a mood of pessimism in the company about future job prospects.

sentence.Network_en: There were good grounds for pessimism about future progress.
sentence.Network_cn: 对将来的发展持悲观态度是有充分依据的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from Latin pessimus 'worst', on the pattern of optimism

entry.def: Pessimism is the belief that bad things are going to happen.

example.tran: 对经济所持的普遍悲观态度

example.ex: My first reaction was one of deep pessimism.
example.tran: 我的第一反应非常悲观。

means.word_mean: 1. the feeling that things will turn out badly
2. a general disposition to look on the dark side and to expect the worst in all things
